alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; Gila Bend; North Phoenix, Glendale; Northwest Valley; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:54PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa County through 645 PM MST... At 554 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Morristown to Palo Verde to near Estrella Mountain Ranch. Movement was southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Glendale, Surprise, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, El Mirage, Tolleson, Youngtown, Tonopah, Sun City West, Waddell, Cashion, Circle City, Sun City, Wittmann, Litchfield Park, Palo Verde, White Tank Mountain Park, Cotton Center and Liberty. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 91 and 134. US Highway 60 between mile markers 123 and 147. AZ Route 101 near mile marker 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Phoenix.
